alert.note: Alert for Clark (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 7:37AM PDT until June 15 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Oregon and Washington... Columbia River at Vancouver affecting Clark and Multnomah Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Columbia River at Vancouver. * WHEN...From this morning to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect flooding of some islands and low areas, with minor impacts for parks and trails along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:48 AM PDT Monday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:48 AM PDT Monday was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 16.1 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM PDT.
